oooohh so that's why it has very few

title: npm stuff -> bun stuff
body:
## changes
- update installation instructions on the readme to use bun, not npm
- edit package.json to use bun commands, instead of npm. (this isn't needed, but makes sense since bun is used)
author: cueboid

comments.body: Bun does not have 100% parity with Node.js currently, so it can't be guaranteed that a deep dependency depends on the Node runtime compared to the Bun runtime. Though, I would note I have used this fine with the Bun runtime; but I think we should keep node instructions to mitigate future issues.
Yes, npm instructions exist because they already come with the node installation, making it easier for the user (and CI/CD) to deploy.

Yeah, I didn't realize that npm was meant to be used. I thought that Bun was meant to be used due to there being a Bun lockfile instead of a npm one. So I thought that the package.json and the readme were incorrect. Maybe it should be replaced by an npm lockfile?

title: Server/Client exits with error code -4058
body:
heya, whenever i run "npm run dev" in the mikumikubeam folder, i get the following:

(node:47328) [DEP0060] DeprecationWarning: The `util._extend` API is deprecated. Please use Object.assign() instead.
(Use `node --trace-deprecation ...` to show where the warning was created)
[0] Error occurred when executing command: npm run dev:client
[0] Error: spawn cmd.exe ENOENT
[0]     at ChildProcess._handle.onexit (node:internal/child_process:286:19)
[0]     at onErrorNT (node:internal/child_process:484:16)

[1] Error occurred when executing command: npm run dev:server
[1] Error: spawn cmd.exe ENOENT
[1]     at ChildProcess._handle.onexit (node:internal/child_process:286:19)
[1]     at onErrorNT (node:internal/child_process:484:16)
[1]     at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:90:21)
[1] npm run dev:server exited with code -4058
[0] npm run dev:client exited with code -4058

Not sure if it's something I'm doing wrong or if something is up with the program. Any help is appreciated though!
author: getmyBEARings

comments.body: Curious. What version of node do you have and what OS/version do you use?
Node is 23.6.0 and I'm running on Windows 11.
Test rn with my latest commit ^^

Okay! After testing I found that the DeprecationWarning is gone, but is replaced with:

> miku-beam@0.0.0 dev
> concurrently --ks SIGKILL -n "Client,Server" "npm run dev:client" "npm run dev:server"

[Client] Error occurred when executing command: npm run dev:client
[Client] Error: spawn cmd.exe ENOENT
[Client]     at ChildProcess._handle.onexit (node:internal/child_process:286:19)
[Client]     at onErrorNT (node:internal/child_process:484:16)
[Client]     at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:90:21)
[Server] Error occurred when executing command: npm run dev:server

[Server]     at ChildProcess._handle.onexit (node:internal/child_process:286:19)
[Server]     at onErrorNT (node:internal/child_process:484:16)
[Server]     at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:90:21)
[Server] npm run dev:server exited with code -4058
[Client] npm run dev:client exited with code -4058

I'm certainly a little new to all of this so just to confirm, I copy the repository with gitbash and then do the npm install and npm run dev in the mikumikubeam folder, correct?
